results.title: Blanche fury
results.creator_credit: Anthony Havelock-Allan, Cineguild and Marc Allegret
results.brief_description: A penniless ambitious governess becomes mistress of a stately home by marrying into the wealthy family of the headstrong Steward, (Stewart Granger), who aspires to run the estate. This is a beautifully mounted period (costume) drama which sits comfortably within the genre as a fine example of a family melodrama. A wronged illegitimate cousin, an illicit love affair and a double murder all contribute to the melodramatic story. Also stars Valerie Hobson.

results.title: Blanche et Claire
results.creator_credit: Paul Larose, ONF | NFB and Guy L. Cote
results.brief_description: Showing the relationship between two women of different ages who share their feelings and dreams, this film causes us to reflect on the right to dream in a world where dreams have no value.

results.title: Blanche
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Lefevre, Telepresse Films, Abel & Charton and Walerian Borowczyk
results.brief_description:
Set in 13th century France, this dark Arthurian tragedy centres on Blanche, the beautiful young wife of an ageing baron, who falls prey to the lusts of three men: her stepson, the king, and his page. Blanche is identified with a caged white dove; around her frightened flutterings her would-be lovers come to grief, one of them literally imprisoned in her bricked-up boudoir. Borowczyk’s initial interest in recreating the period and depicting courtly intrigue is gradually replaced by his characteristic cold, flat formalism - instead of fleshing out his main character (glimpsed stepping out of the bath at the start of the film) Borowczyk turns Blanche into an automaton. Yet despite its almost inhuman, pitiless cruelty, the film achieves a kind of tragic catharsis. Also available on 16mm.

Credits: Producer, Jean-Claude Lefevre ; director, writer, editor, Walerian Borowczyk ; photography, Guy Durban ; production designer, Jacques D’Ovidio ; editor, Charles Bretoneiche.
Cast: Ligia Branice, Michel Simon, Lawrence Trimble, Jacques Perrin, Georges Wilson.

results.title: Blake
results.creator_credit: Douglas Jackson, ONF | NFB and Bill Mason
results.brief_description: In this age, when most people follow their dreams passively on the television screen, there are still a few individuals whose passion is for the real thing. Here is a film about such a one, with a passion for wings and the freedom of the skies. Filmed by Bill Mason, whose own devotion is to the canoe, the subject here is his friend Blake James, another filmmaker, who pilots his own one-man plane. The film is Mason’s view of this “hobo of the skies” but it is also an adventure. Photography: Bill Mason, Blake James. (Five awards, including Oscar nomination, Hollywood.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Douglas Jackson, ONF | NFB and Bill Mason

results.title: Blaine Johnson
results.creator_credit: Werner Schumann, Gordon Weisenborn, Sarah Toughill and Guggenheim Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
Pilot, specialist in farm technology and “crop duster”, Blaine Johnson’s knowledge and study of the latest developments of agriculture benefit the many farms he visits as a duster pilot. Johnson places his skills at the service of the farming community who need him to combat the many kinds of insects which can destroy a crop overnight.

results.title: Blahs, blues and better days
results.creator_credit: Paul Cowan, Directions Unlimited Films, American Educational Films and Noel Nosseck
results.brief_description: Explores the gamut between blues and depression. Differentiates between normal and abnormal reactions to crisis and shows us how to recognise danger signs. In depth case studies of three young people are carried out as two of them seek help and one does not. Others have an opportunity to ask questions about their emotional ups and downs. Dr Marvin Karno of the UCLA Neuro-psychiatric Institute appears as a counsellor to offer authentic doctor/patient experience. Commentary by Joseph Campanella.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Cowan, Directions Unlimited Films, American Educational Films and Noel Nosseck

results.title: Blades and brass
results.brief_description: The best of the 1967 National Hockey League season, set to music in the Tijuana Brass style and filmed with an eye to grace and style of movement suggestive of the bull ring as well as the hockey arena - a novel view, with soaring sound that gives even more drama to the struggle on the ice. Camera tricks enhance the unusual presentation of this fastest of winter sports. Awards: Cortina d’Ampezzo; Kranj.

results.title: Blade runner [Director's cut]
results.creator_credit: Michael Deeley, Ladd Company, Sir Run Run Shaw, Jerry Perenchio, Bud Yorkin and Ridley Scott
results.brief_description: Ridley Scott’s adaptation of Philip K. Dick’s novel “Do androids dream of electric sheep” has rapidly become a classic of the science fiction genre. In Los Angeles, 2019, Deckard, a licensed-to-kill cop is given the task of tracking down and destroying a group of intelligent androids who have hijacked a space shuttle and returned to Earth. In the process Deckard has to confront disturbing questions about what makes a human being. “A richly detailed and visually overwhelming trip to the future which sticks with you like a recurrent nightmare.” Starring Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer and Sean Young.
